intro: Erysimum platycarpun, commonly known as the broad-fruit wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in early spring, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
